item.title: Report E-2024010026
item.description:
Report E-2024010026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: WARSAW
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN WARSAW, POLAND, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM THE NETHERLANDS TO GERMANY WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACK REPLACEMENT WITHOUT EQUIPMENT. THE BATTERY PACK IS MODEL A2042 USED FOR APPLE IPOD PRO 11-INCH BATTERY REPLACEMENT. THE BOX ALSO CONTAINS ELEVEN NON-REGULATED 11-INCH SCREEN REPLACEMENTS WITHOUT LITHIUM BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM ION BATTERY WAS SHIPPING IN THE AIR NETWORK. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON A UPS FLIGHT FROM (CGN) COLOGNE, GERMANY TO DISCOVERY LOCATION (WAS) WARSAW, POLAND PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY DISCOVERY. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT B56671, GREAT THINKERS HOLDING BV, HERCULES 6, GILZE 5126RK, NETHERLANDS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on load side wet, taken to cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was an inner box with 2 x 5.0 liters plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part A. The 1 plastic bottle was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters spill out. The other 2 x 5.0-liter plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part B were not damaged. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The one x 5.0-liter plastic bottle of Rapicide PA Part A was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red lined tote to contain the leaking damaged hazmat, taken to cage.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE ALASKA TWO PACKAGES WITH A DESCRIPTION ON THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL OF AUDIO EQUIPMENT WERE INSPECTED. UPON CONTENT INSPECTION ONE BOX CONTAINS SIXTY RF-309 MODEL WIRELESS HEADPHONES EACH CONTAINING A LITHIUM-ION BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THE SECOND PACKAGE UNDER TRACKING NUMBER 1ZF73V03DG94851258 CONTAINS FORTY RF-309 MODEL WIRELESS HEADPHONES EACH CONTAINING A LITHIUM-ION BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPING FROM USA TO TAIWAN. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM ARIZONA USING UPS ACCOUNT F73V03, PARTY HEADPHONES, 4251 E 5TH STREET, TUCSON ARIZONA 85711.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: ANCHORAGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, AK, ONE PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN INNER BOXES OF LITHIUM-ION BATTERIES ALONE AND LITHIUM-ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT. ONE INNER BOX CONTAINS ONE BLACK DECKER 20 V LITHIUM-ION BATTERY, ONE RYOBI 18V 1.5AH LITHIUM-ION BATTERY, AND ONE RYOBI 18V 4 AH LITHIUM-ION BATTERY. SECOND INNER BOX CONTAINS ONE FADAK WALT 8212A CORDLESS DRILL TOOL KIT PACKED WITH ONE 1.3AH LITHIUM-ION BATTERY. THIRD INNER BOX CONTAINS ONE PULITUO DC-7120S CORDLESS DRILL TOOL KIT PACKED WITH A 20 V LITHIUM-ION BATTERY. FOURTH INNER BOX CONTAINS ONE AULUMU MODEL M01 4-IN-1 FOLDING MAGNETIC CHARGING STATION THAT APPEARS TO BE POWERED BY AN ADAPTER AND CABLE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS BEING SHIPPED FROM USA TO CHINA. INVOICE AND THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIPTION IS ELECTRIC DRILL.

PH WAS TESTED AS A 0. SODIUM BICARBONATE WAS USED AND AREA WAS RETESTED AS A 7. ALL MATERIAL WAS CONTAINERIZED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY WITH A FIBER BROOK AND A PLASTIC DUSTPAN. ALL RESIDUE WAS REMOVED FORM THE SPILL LOCATION AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023121148
item.description:
Report X-2023121148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE LOADER ON THE PD-8. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE TOP SECTION OF A METAL 5-GAL PAIL WAS SLIGHTLY DENTED, CREATING A BREACH THAT CAUSED APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK FROM AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: A FULLY MARKED AND REGULATED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED IN A TRAILER IN UNLOAD C. THE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED. DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAPS ON EACH ONE OF THE FOUR INNER CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 2 OUNCES HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON AND INNER PARTION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin spotted the package sitting top down next to an induction belt and alerted manager. Upon seeing the yellow leakage, area was covered in neutralizing agent to absorb the spill. Package appears to have fallen from to of belt and landed on the caps, causing the failure. No other damage was caused and location has been cleaned. DescribePack: Package appears to have landed on its caps, causing the failure. Spill covered an area of about 2 square meters. Caps were not loose, leading me to believe the impact cause the leakage. From what we were able to observe, there was no evident source of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizing absorbent agent was spread over spill, and package was placed in a containment bag and bin.

  • Description: On December 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1789 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Compliance Technologies (ACT) to remediate the impacted site. ACT personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted trailer floor and soil under the trailer. Crews tightened the bung and the leak stopped. Crews secured the drum upright to the trailer wall and the driver continued on to the terminal. Utilizing hand tools, the ACT crew was able to excavate the impacted soil. All impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was taken by ACT.

item.description:
Report X-2023120592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR OF LEAKING PACKAGE. SUPERVISOR CALLED IT OUT ON THE RADIO. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ALONG WITH THE RMP RESPONDED TO PD 11 DOOR 151 GRATES AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. AFTER SEEING WHAT THE PACKAGE WAS AND TYPE OF HAZMAT, IT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TRY WITH ZEP ABSORBENT. ZEP ABSORBENT WAS THEN USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL THAT WAS ON THE FLOOR UNDER THE GRATES. THE GRATES WERE NOT LEAKED ON. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO PSC AREA TO BE PROCESSED. CHROMEX BINDER A WAS THE LEAKING BOTTLE. THE LID WAS FOUND TO BE OFF WITH NO SEAL. THIS WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBANT. CHROMEX BINDER B WAS FIRST NEUTROLIZED USING SODIUM BICARB, THEN WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBENT. BOTH DESIGNATED RESPONDER AND RMP WORE THE CORRECT PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

  • Description: 1. X-2023120883 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package of "ZEP CLOG ATTACK" to be wet, torn open, with internal leakage, and with 1 loose cap. Damage most likely from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated. 2. X-2023120888 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGN OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION TWO BOTTLES OF ZEP CLOG ATTACK WAS FOUND MISSING AND ONE SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE ZEP CLOG ATTACK CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1.1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1.1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774200642190 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1593 CLASS=61 PSN TEXT=DICHLOROMETHANE PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.004 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.004 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774200642190 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1760 CLASS=80 PSN TEXT=CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S. The shipper has been contacted for an amended Declaration and further disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 4:56 am at door 10 in the unload PH called out to management that there was a leaking hazmat package. Manager addressed the issue quickly by grabbing gloves, apron and hazmat spill bin. Grabbed 3 hazmat package out the back of trailer #836334 from FTWO that were affected by the one leaking hazmat. Took the bin over to QA to separate corrosive spill from explosive hazmat. DescribePack: Hazmat package failure was a corrosive package that was laid inappropriately on his side instead up right by the orientation arrows. Another identical hazmat package was also inappropriately laid on its side on top of the leaking hazmat. Bottom hazmat was crushed by the pressure and had a failed lid closure due to weight and being laid inappropriately and unsafely in back of the trailer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat bin immediately upon discovery. Loose lid was also tightened.

Upon further investigation of the HAZMAT Pail, I covered the opening with tape so I could test if the seal was actually broken or not. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: I taped the cap of the pail opening to avoid anymore of the smell escaping.

  • Description: On 11/22/23, the UTLX 205951 was found in the Barstow railyard to be leaking methanol from the top of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car and the inspection revealed liquid leaking through the packing stem. The valve was found in the partially open position and was missing the packing retainer nut. The valve and release were secured with a pin. On 11/30/23, Graymar Env returned to further secure the valve by adding a packing sleeve and retainer nut. The car was pressure tested to verify integrity of repairs. No leaks were found. Shipper advised of need to get OTMA for movement to destination.

item.title: Report E-2023120385
item.description:
Report E-2023120385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: KAUKAUNA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: • We had weather issues right out of the gate with freezing. Product freezes at 50-52 degrees • Initially when he opened the trailer and customer valves (internal and external) nothing was flowing. • Stopped, shut compressor off, closed the airline and internal and external. Bled the pressure off the line. No pressure was on the line or product. Used 50 foot airline and blew heat on the QRB to warm it up. Gave up on that. The customer had steam so they heated the valve. Got product flowing. • He had 2 hoses to make delivery. He had a wall to his right side and the back of the truck. As such the first hose had to loop around to get it under the trailer to the wall where there was a 6” hole where part of his second hose went through the wall and connected to the customer fill line 3-4 feet inside. After the fill line hook up there is a shut off valve roughly 8” after that. The fill line then goes vertical to the ceiling and then over and in to the tank. • The product (Bevrosheen) was very slushy. This was tied to compartment 3. • At the end of the offload he saw the hose rise up and could feel the hose was light. • He shut down and then cracked his external open and walked the line to the customer tank and shut their fill line and the internal and external valves on the trailer. • At this point he went to bleed the pressure off the hoses but the chicago cap for the bleeder valve was froze on. He used a screw driver to break it free. He then lifted his pale up to the bleeder valve and opened it ¼ of the way and nothing came out. He continued to open it more and nothing came out. Both he and the unloader knew that it must be blocked with frozen product. With the bleeder valve closed now he used a screw driver to get it clear of frozen product. It then depressurized as expected when he opened the valve. He commented that the amount of time it took to depressurize was consistent with how long it normally takes. The process to get the bleeder valve clear from frozen product took roughly 3-5 minutes which is noteworthy as this was time the hoses with product inside were sitting idle in the cold weather • Richard was able to safely disconnect the hose (ie – any pressure in the hose in theory is clearly gone at this point) and reducer fitting from the trailer and then capped off the reducer fitting. He kept the reducer fitting on that end of the hose attached as the unloader was going to take the reducer and two hoses and rinse them out together for our driver. When the unloader got the one end of the hose with the reducer fitting on it near the wash station he laid it down and uncapped it again (again no pressure coming out of it). Our driver now moved to the customer fill line and he loosened the camlock (right side) furthest away from him first and then the left side closest too him (following protocol) which is when the hose blew off of the fill line down towards the ground with a line of product shooting up at him.

item.title: Report X-2023110998
item.description:
Report X-2023110998

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T00:33:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 30, 2023, at 1930 hours, during switching operations on the south end of the CN Geismar yard, a CN crew switched a cut of cars into track GE02. Upon coupling into a stationary cut of cars, product was observed releasing from the top of one of the railcars. The local Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) was immediately notified of the release. Upon arrival at the yard, the DGO observed product on the exterior of RCRX 1684 (load / UN 1789 / Class 8). The railcar was further investigated and inspected, observing liquid around the housing and in the bowl of the external spring safety relief device indicating activation of the safety relief valve. The liquid was tested with pH paper indicating a pH of 1-2. All top fittings and closures were inspected and found to be tool tight. The railcar was observed for 45 minutes, with no additional product observed releasing. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The shipper responded the next day to remove the safety relief for testing.

  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: EAST PENN LOGISTICS LLC

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: Driver picked up junk industrial forklift batteries at retail store for recycling. During transit 2 of the pallets collapsed. The leak was detected at a truck stop when the driver checked his load. He noticed that 2 of the pallets failed and broke causing the batteries on the pallets to fall over and leak. The driver used soda ash (approximately 1.5 gallons) to create a dam/ berm, at the back of the trailer to prevent acid leaking out the door. He also spread some on the floor. A HazMat crew was called by corporate to assist in the clean-up. The HazMat team used speedy dry, and soda ash to clean up/ neutralize the acid inside the trailer as well as what leaked outside of the trailer on the black top. No acid had gotten into any storm drains. Once the acid was no longer leaking· the trailer was moved to a local customer to help upright and reload the batteries. The HazMat team cleaned out the trailer before it was reloaded. One drum of spent acid/ soda ash was collected for disposal by the Hazmat team. Once reloaded the driver continued to East Penn Manufacturing Co. for battery recycling.

item.title: Report I-2023100027
item.description:
Report I-2023100027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T00:33:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: CRAWFORDSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DOUBLE J TRANSPORT INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Tuesday, May 16, 2023 at 11:48am, I (Deputy Anthony Teal #5421} responded to a personal injury crash on Interstate 74, westbound at the 34 MM. At the time of the crash the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. The driver (Michael Pender} of Vehicle #1 (white 2001 International 9100i, IN tag 3076627) advised he was traveling west on Interstate 74 pulling a tank trailer (IN tag SP698LBD} when he noticed vehicles slowing in front of him due to a traffic back up on the interstate offramp (roadWay construction on US Route 231 }. According to Michael, he felt like he had no where else to go but into the guardrail because another semi-trailer truck was blocking the left lane (passing lane). Michael's semi tractor and tank trailer struck the guardrail on the north side of the highway, overturned, and rolled down an embankment coming to rest on its passenger side. The tank trailer was carrying approximately 7,000-gallons of gasoline and 1,000-gallons of diesel fuel. The crash created a leak in the tanker that was carrying gasoline. Once the Crawfordsville Fire Department (CFO} arrived they were able stop the leak and contain the spill. Montgomery County Emergency Management (EMA} was contacted and arrived on scene to assist with the spill. Ultimately, a secondary tanker was brought to the scene by Bowman's (Brownsburg, IN} to offload the flammable liquids. The westbound lanes of Interstate 74 were closed for a period of time because of the accident. The wrecked semi tractor and tank trailer were recovered from the ditch by Wilson's Towing. Driver Michael Pender appeared to be disoriented at the scene due to a head injury. He was able to self-extricate from his semi, but complained of pain to his head and was treated by Crawfordsville Fire Department Medics. Medics then transported him to Franciscan Hospital by ambulance (#4155 ). Indiana State Police (ISP) Commercial Vehicle Enforcement Division arrived on scene and performed a vehicle inspection on Vehicle #1. Witness Catherine Crosby stopped at the accident scene and provided a statement Catherine said she was driving west on Interstate 7 4 in the right lane (slow lane} when she observed two semi trucks in front of her occupying the left and right lanes. She stated that traffic in front of the semi trucks began to slow. She then saw the semi tractor with the tank trailer drive off the roadway, strike the guardrail, overturn three times, and end up at the bottom of an embankment. I inquired if she noticed anything about the driver of the semi. Catherine said nothing other than he appeared to have a head injury.
